data.enText: far away from places where other people live

data.chText: 世界上最荒僻的地区之一
data.enText: one of the remotest areas of the world

data.chText: 这家农舍附近没有别的房屋。
data.enText: The farmhouse is remote from any other buildings.

data.chText: 在遥远的过去 / 将来

data.enText: a remote ancestor (= who lived a long time ago)
that you can connect to from far away, using an electronic link

data.chText: 相差很大的；极不相同的
他的理论有点儿脱离现实。
data.enText: His theories are somewhat remote from reality.
not very friendly or interested in other people

data.chText: 他们仍然有一线希望能把她活着找到。
data.enText: There is still a remote chance that they will find her alive.

data.chText: 你在说什么我一点都不懂。
data.enText: I don't have the remotest idea what you're talking about.
the geographical remoteness of the island

data.chText: 他的冷漠使她觉得他不爱她。
data.enText: His remoteness made her feel unloved.

ex.chText: 他听到了远处的爆竹声。
ex.enText: He heard the sound of distant firecrackers.

ex.chText: 她快乐的童年生活成为了遥远的回忆。
ex.enText: Her happy childhood became a distant memory.

synonyms.bx: 指在空间或时间上遥远的。

ex.enText: He can jump the furthest in his class.

ex.chText: 她选了一所离家不远的大学。
ex.enText: She chose a university not far from home.

ex.chText: 她梦想着在一个遥远的岛上度过余生。
ex.enText: She dreamed of spending the rest of her life on a faraway island.

synonyms.bx: 多指距离很远的，只作定语。

ex.chText: 毕业之后，他在一个偏远小镇当起了中学老师。
ex.enText: After graduation, he became a high school teacher in a remote town.

synonyms.bx: 指远离多人聚居的城镇或其他处所的。

tr: a device that can be used to control a machine or apparatus from a distance
example: he lost the remote for his TV

tr: far apart in relevance or relationship or kinship
example: considerations entirely removed (or remote) from politics

value.def: Remote areas are far away from cities and places where most people live, and are therefore difficult to get to.

example.ex: Landslides have cut off many villages in remote areas.
example.tran: 滑坡使边远地区的许多村庄与外界隔绝。

example.ex: ...a remote farm in the Yorkshire dales.
example.tran: 位于约克郡山谷的一个偏僻的农场

value.def: The remote past or remote future is a time that is many years distant from the present.

example.ex: Slabs of rock had slipped sideways in the remote past, and formed this hole.
example.tran: 在久远的过去，岩石板滑落到周边，从而形成了这个洞。

value.def: If something is remote from a particular subject or area of experience, it is not relevant to it because it is very different.

example.ex: This government depends on the wishes of a few who are remote from the people...
example.tran: 这个政府按照远离民众的少数人的意愿行事。

example.ex: Teenagers are forced to study subjects that seem remote from their daily lives.
example.tran: 青少年被迫学习和他们的日常生活关系不大的学科。

value.tran: 关系不紧密的;关系疏远的;相距甚远的

example.ex: ...the remoteness of the officers from their men.
example.tran: 军官与其部下之间关系的疏远

value.def: If you say that there is a remote possibility or chance that something will happen, you are emphasizing that there is only a very small chance that it will happen.

example.ex: I use a sunscreen whenever there is even a remote possibility that I will be in the sun...
example.tran: 不论何时只要有一点可能暴露在阳光下，我就会用防晒霜。

example.ex: The chances of his surviving are pretty remote.
example.tran: 他生还的机会非常渺茫。

value.tran: (可能性或机会)渺茫的，微乎其微的

value.def: If you describe someone as remote, you mean that they behave as if they do not want to be friendly or closely involved with other people.

example.ex: She looked so beautiful, and at the same time so remote.
example.tran: 她相貌如此美丽，同时又如此清高不群。

value.tran: 冷漠的;冷淡的;与人疏远的;清高的
